verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, The heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool: where is the house that ye build unto me? and where is the place of my rest?
verses.web: LORD says, “Heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool. What kind of house will you build to me? Where will I rest?
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "Heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool. What kind of house could you possibly build for me? Where would I go to rest?

verses.kjv: For all those things hath mine hand made, and all those things have been, saith the LORD: but to this man will I look, even to him that is poor and of a contrite spirit, and trembleth at my word.
verses.web: For my hand has made all these things, and so all these things came to be,” says LORD: “but I will look to this man, even to he who is poor and of a contrite spirit, and who trembles at my word.
verses.ct: My own hand made all of these things — that's how everything came to be," declares the LORD. "But here is the person I pay attention to: the one who is humble, broken in spirit, and trembles at my word."

verses.kjv: He that killeth an ox is as if he slew a man; he that sacrificeth a lamb, as if he cut off a dog’s neck; he that offereth an oblation, as if he offered swine’s blood; he that burneth incense, as if he blessed an idol. Yea, they have chosen their own ways, and their soul delighteth in their abominations.
verses.web: He who kills an ox is as he who kills a man; he who sacrifices a lamb, as he who breaks a dog’s neck; he who offers an offering, as he who offers pig’s blood; he who burns frankincense, as he who blesses an idol. Yes, they have chosen their own ways, and their soul delights in their abominations:
verses.ct: "But these people — when they slaughter an ox, it's no different than murdering a man. When they sacrifice a lamb, it's like snapping a dog's neck. When they bring a grain offering, it's like offering pig's blood. When they burn incense, it's like praising an idol. They've chosen their own ways, and their soul takes pleasure in disgusting things.

verses.kjv: I also will choose their delusions, and will bring their fears upon them; because when I called, none did answer; when I spake, they did not hear: but they did evil before mine eyes, and chose that in which I delighted not.
verses.web: I also will choose their delusions, and will bring their fears on them; because when I called, no one answered; when I spoke, they didn’t listen; but they did that which was evil in my eyes, and chose that in which I didn’t delight.”
verses.ct: So I will choose harsh treatment for them and bring on them the very things they dread. When I called out, no one answered. When I spoke, no one listened. Instead, they did what the LORD saw as evil and chose what displeases me."

verses.kjv: Hear the word of the LORD, ye that tremble at his word; Your brethren that hated you, that cast you out for my name’s sake, said, Let the LORD be glorified: but he shall appear to your joy, and they shall be ashamed.
verses.web: Hear LORD’s word, you who tremble at his word: “Your brothers who hate you, who cast you out for my name’s sake, have said, ‘Let LORD be glorified, that we may see your joy;’ but it is those who shall be disappointed.
verses.ct: Listen to the word of the LORD, you who tremble at his word: "Your own brothers hate you and have thrown you out because of my name. They mocked you, saying, 'Let the LORD show his glory so we can see your joy!' But they are the ones who will be put to shame."

verses.kjv: A voice of noise from the city, a voice from the temple, a voice of the LORD that rendereth recompence to his enemies.
verses.web: A voice of tumult from the city, a voice from the temple, a voice of LORD that repays his enemies what they deserve.
verses.ct: Listen! An uproar from the city! A voice from the temple! It is the voice of the LORD, paying back his enemies exactly what they deserve.

verses.kjv: Before she travailed, she brought forth; before her pain came, she was delivered of a man child.
verses.web: “Before she travailed, she gave birth. Before her pain came, she delivered a son.
verses.ct: "Before she even went into labor, she gave birth. Before the pain hit her, she delivered a son.

verses.kjv: Who hath heard such a thing? who hath seen such things? Shall the earth be made to bring forth in one day? or shall a nation be born at once? for as soon as Zion travailed, she brought forth her children.
verses.web: Who has heard of such a thing? Who has seen such things? Shall a land be born in one day? Shall a nation be born at once? For as soon as Zion travailed, she gave birth to her children.
verses.ct: Who has ever heard of such a thing? Who has ever seen anything like it? Can a country be born in a single day? Can a nation spring to life all at once? Yet the moment Zion went into labor, she gave birth to her children.

verses.kjv: Shall I bring to the birth, and not cause to bring forth? saith the LORD: shall I cause to bring forth, and shut the womb? saith thy God.
verses.web: Shall I bring to the birth, and not cause to be delivered?” says LORD. “Shall I who cause to give birth shut the womb?” says your God.
verses.ct: Would I bring a baby to the point of birth and then not deliver it?" says the LORD. "Would I, the one who brings life, close the womb?" says your God.

verses.kjv: Rejoice ye with Jerusalem, and be glad with her, all ye that love her: rejoice for joy with her, all ye that mourn for her:
verses.web: “Rejoice with Jerusalem, and be glad for her, all you who love her. Rejoice for joy with her, all you who mourn over her;
verses.ct: "Celebrate with Jerusalem and be glad for her, all you who love her! Share deeply in her joy, all you who have mourned over her.

verses.kjv: That ye may suck, and be satisfied with the breasts of her consolations; that ye may milk out, and be delighted with the abundance of her glory.
verses.web: that you may nurse and be satisfied at the comforting breasts; that you may drink deeply, and be delighted with the abundance of her glory.”
verses.ct: You will nurse and be satisfied from her comforting breasts. You will drink deeply and be delighted by the overflow of her glory."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will extend peace to her like a river, and the glory of the Gentiles like a flowing stream: then shall ye suck, ye shall be borne upon her sides, and be dandled upon her knees.
verses.web: For LORD says, “Behold, I will extend peace to her like a river, and the glory of the nations like an overflowing stream; and you will nurse. You will be carried on her side, and will be dandled on her knees.
verses.ct: The LORD says, "Look! I will send peace flowing to her like a river, and the wealth of nations streaming to her like a flood. You will nurse and be carried on her hip and bounced on her knees.

verses.kjv: As one whom his mother comforteth, so will I comfort you; and ye shall be comforted in Jerusalem.
verses.web: As one whom his mother comforts, so I will comfort you. You will be comforted in Jerusalem.”
verses.ct: Like a mother comforts her child, that's how I will comfort you — and you will find that comfort in Jerusalem."

verses.kjv: And when ye see this, your heart shall rejoice, and your bones shall flourish like an herb: and the hand of the LORD shall be known toward his servants, and his indignation toward his enemies.
verses.web: You will see it, and your heart shall rejoice, and your bones will flourish like the tender grass. LORD’s hand will be known among his servants; and he will have indignation against his enemies.
verses.ct: When you see this, your heart will burst with joy, and your body will thrive like fresh green grass. The LORD's power will be revealed to his servants, but his fury will fall on his enemies.

verses.kjv: For, behold, the LORD will come with fire, and with his chariots like a whirlwind, to render his anger with fury, and his rebuke with flames of fire.
verses.web: For, behold, LORD will come with fire, and his chariots will be like the whirlwind; to render his anger with fierceness, and his rebuke with flames of fire.
verses.ct: Look — the LORD is coming with fire! His chariots will roar in like a whirlwind. He will unleash his anger with burning fury and his punishment with flames of fire.

verses.kjv: For by fire and by his sword will the LORD plead with all flesh: and the slain of the LORD shall be many.
verses.web: For LORD will execute judgment by fire and by his sword on all flesh; and those slain by LORD will be many.
verses.ct: The LORD will execute judgment on all people with fire and sword, and those killed by the LORD will be beyond counting.

verses.kjv: They that sanctify themselves, and purify themselves in the gardens behind one tree in the midst, eating swine’s flesh, and the abomination, and the mouse, shall be consumed together, saith the LORD.
verses.web: “Those who sanctify themselves and purify themselves to go to the gardens, behind one in the middle, eating pig’s meat, abominable things, and the mouse, they shall come to an end together,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "Those who perform rituals to make themselves 'holy' and 'pure' in their sacred gardens, following the one in the center, eating pig meat, disgusting things, and mice — they will all be destroyed together," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: For I know their works and their thoughts: it shall come, that I will gather all nations and tongues; and they shall come, and see my glory.
verses.web: “For I know their works and their thoughts. The time comes that I will gather all nations and languages, and they will come, and will see my glory.
verses.ct: "I know everything they do and everything they think. The time is coming when I will gather every nation and every language together, and they will come and witness my glory.

verses.kjv: And I will set a sign among them, and I will send those that escape of them unto the nations, to Tarshish, Pul, and Lud, that draw the bow, to Tubal, and Javan, to the isles afar off, that have not heard my fame, neither have seen my glory; and they shall declare my glory among the Gentiles.
verses.web: “I will set a sign among them, and I will send those who escape of them to the nations, to Tarshish, Pul, and Lud, who draw the bow, to Tubal and Javan, to far-away islands, who have not heard my fame, nor have seen my glory; and they shall declare my glory among the nations.
verses.ct: I will set a sign among them and send survivors to the nations — to Tarshish, Pul, and Lud (the archers), to Tubal and Javan, to the distant coastlands that have never heard of me or seen my glory. They will announce my glory among the nations.

verses.kjv: And they shall bring all your brethren for an offering unto the LORD out of all nations upon horses, and in chariots, and in litters, and upon mules, and upon swift beasts, to my holy mountain Jerusalem, saith the LORD, as the children of Israel bring an offering in a clean vessel into the house of the LORD.
verses.web: They shall bring all your brothers out of all the nations for an offering to LORD, on horses, in chariots, in litters, on mules, and on camels, to my holy mountain Jerusalem, says LORD, as the children of Israel bring their offering in a clean vessel into LORD’s house.
verses.ct: They will bring all your scattered brothers and sisters from every nation as an offering to the LORD — on horses, in chariots, in wagons, on mules, and on camels — to my holy mountain Jerusalem," says the LORD. "It will be just like when the people of Israel bring their offerings in clean vessels to the LORD's house.

verses.kjv: And I will also take of them for priests and for Levites, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Of them I will also select priests and Levites,” says LORD.
verses.ct: And from among them I will even choose some to serve as priests and Levites," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: For as the new heavens and the new earth, which I will make, shall remain before me, saith the LORD, so shall your seed and your name remain.
verses.web: “For as the new heavens and the new earth, which I will make, shall remain before me,” says LORD, “so your offspring and your name shall remain.
verses.ct: "Just as the new heavens and the new earth that I create will endure before me," declares the LORD, "so will your descendants and your name endure.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that from one new moon to another, and from one sabbath to another, shall all flesh come to worship before me, saith the LORD.
verses.web: It shall happen that from one new moon to another, and from one Sabbath to another, all flesh will come to worship before me,” says LORD.
verses.ct: From one New Moon to the next, and from one Sabbath to the next, all of humanity will come and worship before me," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: And they shall go forth, and look upon the carcases of the men that have transgressed against me: for their worm shall not die, neither shall their fire be quenched; and they shall be an abhorring unto all flesh.
verses.web: “They will go out, and look at the dead bodies of the men who have transgressed against me; for their worm will not die, nor will their fire be quenched, and they will be loathsome to all mankind.”
verses.ct: "They will go out and look at the dead bodies of those who rebelled against me. The worms feeding on them will never die, and the fire burning them will never go out. They will be an object of horror to all of humanity."
